item.title: Mint Explainer | What’s behind Jane Street’s SAT appeal against Sebi in the index manipulation case

review.headline_rewrite: Mint Explainer | What’s behind Jane Street’s SAT appeal against Sebi in the index manipulation case
bullets: Mint Explainer | What’s behind Jane Street’s SAT appeal against Sebi in the index manipulation case Jane Street alleges Sebi overlooked its own reviews
On Wednesday, four entities of the global trading firm moved the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi),
At stake is not only a ₹4,843 crore escrow deposit but also the question of whether Sebi suppressed exculpatory findings while accusing Jane Street
The core of Jane Street’s appeal is that two earlier reviews—one by the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and another by Sebi’s Integrated Surveillance Department

item.title: AC, large TVs, dishwashers to get cheaper; GST cut to drive festive buys, say Consumer durable makers

review.headline_rewrite: AC, large TVs, dishwashers to get cheaper; GST cut to drive festive buys, say Consumer durable makers
bullets: Manish Sharma, Chairman, Panasonic Life Solutions India said, “The rationalisation of GST on air-conditioners and televisions to 18 per cent is a welcome reform
With this reduction, products that were earlier seen as aspirational are now more accessible, allowing a larger section of households to upgrade to energy-efficient
“The GST rate cut will amplify demand in Tier 2 and 3 cities where aspirations are growing with rising disposable income but sentimentally price-sensitive.

item.title: Crude oil futures drop on potential OPEC supply boost

review.headline_rewrite: Crude oil futures drop on potential OPEC supply boost
bullets: Crude oil futures traded lower on Thursday morning following reports of a likely production hike by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries and its
At 9.55 am on Thursday, November Brent oil futures were at $67.17, down by 0.64 per cent, and October crude oil futures on WTI
September crude oil futures were trading at ₹5,600 on Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) during the initial hour of trading on Thursday against the previous
Another output boost would mean OPEC+, which pumps about half of the world’s oil, would be starting to unwind a second layer of cuts
